title: Fixes note annotation about moduleActive being a property of Module
message:
Fixes note annotation about moduleActive being a property of Module

Since ofApp needs to know about which is the current module active in
order to be able to drawLines() correctly, moduleActive shouldn't be a
property of Module, but rather kept static (like is now) in ofApp.

title: Fixes #115 (wrong boundary for buttons)
message:
Fixes #115 (wrong boundary for buttons)

We were keeping logic in the draw function, instead of defining it in
the constructors. That way, the draw() method doesn't need to know about
calculating the sizes, which makes a lot of sense. It just needs to know
how to draw a rect and a title and that's it.

Minor refactor in other pieces of code for clarity.

title: Implements both portrait and landscape mode (#89)
message:
Implements both portrait and landscape mode (#89)

Had to restructure the code quite a bit for this one. The difficult part
was to be able to maintain the state (position of the particles
basically) while also drawing everything correctly. It is a simple as
having a different update cycle when orientation happens. The way to
manage this easily in code was to encapsulate as much behaviour as
possible inside the classes (Module, ModuleConsole, Button and Fader)
and outside the main ofApp class with little repetition. For that I used
a .setDimensions() method "pattern" that is both called by the
constructor of the class when starting the app as well as when
orientation changes. I do that for all the four aforementioned classes
and that is pretty much it.

Apart from that, so minor bug fixes included:

- the modules were starting with wrong values of y, namely the first one
  with y=0, the second one with y=1, and the following two ones with y=2
  and y=3, which generated some minor yet noticeably visible artifacts.

- clearer convention for defines and helper defines too;

- better type safe signatures methods: was using float when should
  clearly be int;

- removed some obsolete code: icons stuff, different drawing routines,
  etc.

title: Fixes #65 (change collision check to the outer circle)
message:
Fixes #65 (change collision check to the outer circle)

As a matter of fact this is not changing the collision check at all. As mentioned in the issue, it is changing how the draw function was making use of the data members of the class, that I don't see the point in doing it like so. Whatever other stylistic fixes we need to do, we should do it on top of the data members and not on or with the data the members.

use the update() methods instead of the draw() ones when appropriate.

get and that is enough.
- managedParticle is simply a local variable
